pullRequest.title: Fix error reporting for SSL resources outside of config dir
pullRequest.bodyText:
Removing error messages for missing, unreadable or blocked config files that are no longer used because the reloader fails before running the config classes.
Closes #63451

commit.message: Fix error reporting for SSL resources outside of config dir

Revert "Fix error reporting for SSL resources outside of config dir"

This reverts commit d40c2b66dfbf367896182c1db79a5e0953a1e6ea.
moving creation of ssl service before ssl resource watcher
ensure ssl configuration files are readable
Report exceptions rather than throw them

nodes.bodyText: I don't think it's really necessary, but corresponding error messages during SSL Context building are finer grained, e.g. different error messages are logged for different subtypes of IOException, security permission failure is explicitly called out.
Nit: isn't this redundant since the above constructor would have failed already if the object does not get created?
I think these are no longer needed given the new change of reporting error instead of throwing.

Based on the exceptions that get caught in startWatching, do we need another method for testing IOException? I suggest we modify this method to be more generic to cover both scenarios and randomize the exception.
